intro: Bupleurum candollei f. obtusifolium, commonly known as the obtuse-leaved bupleurum, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound umbels. The plant features slender, branched stems and broad, ovate leaves with a rounded base. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and arranged in complex inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
